Story.title: Kate: Wallflower Power
Story.Description: Kate's always felt shy and awkward. Taken for granted, left behind, she's made peace with the fact that she's never going to have a full-page yearbook spread or get invited to parties. But now that popular Nicholas has asked her out, is this her in to the in-crowd? Or would she be better off thriving in a garden of wallflowers?

TidBit.text: Kate might discover firsthand the implications of that dreaded term, 'friend zone.'
A secret crush on a best friend? Nobody knows who started the rumor, but everybody's whispering Kate's name...
Better to hide her crush on a friend or come out with it and make things awkward? High school is full of hard decisions...
The popular kids are starting to notice Kate, even despite her outfit.
Kate's made some new friends in a most unlikely place.
Kate, popular? Her sixth grade teacher would hardly recognize her.
If anyone deserves a taste of popularity, it's Kate. That sweet girl has earned fame and recognition more than any of those other backstabbers.
Sometimes even the sweetest exterior can hide a bitter heart. But Kate...?
When Kate read Shakespeare in honors English, she never thought any of those terrible betrayers might become models of behavior...
Kate's learning the truth behind the old saying 'Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.'
Et tu, Kate? No one would believe she could betray a friend. (But isn't that always the way?)

Level.title: Tuesday: Beginning of the End
Level.Description: At lunch break, Kate scans the familiar faces. There's only twelve minutes before fifth period starts. Instead of sitting alone with a sandwich, today she'll try to make some changes.

Level.title: Wednesday: After School Special
Level.Description: Catching up to some kids in the parking lot, Kate tries to fit in. Why won't anyone take her seriously?

Level.title: Thursday: In the Halls
Level.Description: Between classes, Kate has one last chance before Prom to make things happen. Don't blow it now!

Level.title: Friday: THE PROM
Level.Description: It's the big night at last. Will things turn out the way Kate wants? Or will the night be another unmemorable disappointment?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hey Kate, how's your Prom going?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, you know. I guess I was hoping something magical would happen but...
...somehow I never can figure out how to get the magic to happen to me.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well you can't just stand there and expect the magic to come to you.
You have to go out and get it!
'Carpe Magicum!'

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I guess. But I've wasted so much time. High school's over. Why do I have to be such a late bloomer?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Don't freak out, girl. You've got your whole life ahead of you. There's summer, college, and your twenties, and I hear your thirties can be pretty cool too if you don't mind the arthritis.
You'll figure it out.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Thanks, %r%. Would.... would you like to dance with me?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It would be my pleasure.
Oh...... hi, Kate.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look.... I hope you don't hate me. Please say you don't hate me. I never wanted anything to come between our friendship.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Are you saying you're over your crush?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I... I don't know, %r%. That's the truth. I wish I could say I was, but... it's complicated.
All I know is... I really care about you, a lot. And I hope that we can stay friends, because... I would hate to be a bad spot in your high school memories.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You aren't, Kate. You so aren't.
Hey look. No hard feelings, okay? Nobody can control who they crush on. We'll probably laugh about it eventually, right?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Eventually? Why not start now?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well... it is pretty funny.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What's funny is imagining me dating someone wearing *that* outfit!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, Kate... you crack me up.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Check it out, I'm totally livevlogging this to my SkimddIt HD feed. Wave to the viewers!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Uh, hi!
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Sup interweb losers!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Man, I still can't believe I'm hanging with *you guys* now. I mean, if I had a vlog, I don't think I'd have any viewers at all!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh shut up, you totally would. You just have to promote yourself more, girl. Sell what's cool about *you*.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: And what's that?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: It's your *you*, %buddy%... you have this genuine quality that none of us can touch.

I mean, look at %r% here. In fifth grade %pron(r,he/she)% was already planning to break the campaign promises %pron(r,he/she)% was making in %pron(r,his/her)% bid for elementary school class president.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh whatever, %o%. As if you're any better.
But Kate %buddy%... you *are* better. That's why we like you, apart from your minimalist fashion sense and folksy complexion.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Uh... thanks?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: The point is, you got it, girl. And don't be afraid to flaunt it when you need to.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Now let's go hit the dance floor and show this school what a real prom night looks like.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hello, Kate. Having a good prom so far?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yeah, %r%, it's been pretty good. Uh... you?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, you know. Still trying to understand why someone I considered my friend would have thrown me under the bus like you did.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%... when %toc1%... I wish I could take it back.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: But you can't. Oh well I guess.
But is that really the kind of person you are now, Kate?
Was it all worth it?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I think you should go, %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I'll go. But first, I wanted to give you something.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What's this?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It's a marble. You gave it to me in second grade, after some fourth graders stole it and made me cry.
They threw it in some bushes, but you found it later, and brought it back to me.
I'm sure you forgot all about that. But I kept it all this time. I don't know why.
Goodbye, Kate. No, keep the marble... in case you need it again someday.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I will, %r%. I will.
So anyway %r%, I love your %gender(r,suit,dress)%. It's so '10s!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Thanks girl! Oh, that reminds me, we totally need to get you some better clothes. That ratty old jeans and t-shirt look just *has* to go.
Uh oh, here comes the loser train.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Having a fun Prom with all your new friends, Kate?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: %o%! Are you *drunk*?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: I'm here to talk to Kate. Someone who used to be my friend.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %o%, come on. Don't make a scene. You're embarrassing me.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: What happened to you, Kate? You used to be someone I looked up to. You were one of the only people in this crappy school who still had integrity.
And what did you do? You threw it all away, just to be friends with these soulless fashion-loving sycophants.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, are you referring to me? I'm sorry, I got bored with this conversation and started texting snide comments about it to people. Do carry on.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Come on, Kate. Tell this %pejorative% what a scumbag %pron(r,he/she)% is. Your old friends miss you.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sorry, %o%. I made my choices. And now... I have to live with them.
